title: Simple Past Or Past Continuous Tense

questions.question: I ............................. I didn't hear the door bell.
questions.description: We use the past continuous to talk about an action or situation that was going on at a particular point of time in the past.

questions.question: I ......................... her many times but she didn't answer.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about finished actions in the past.

questions.question: He ......................... money from the rich and gave it to the poor.
questions.description: The simple past is used to talk about all types of finished actions in the past.

questions.question: 'Did you meet James yesterday?' 'Yes, I .................... him.'

questions.description: The simple past is used to talk about finished actions in the past.

questions.question: The children ............................. when their mother .................... home.
questions.description: When we talk about two past events, the past continuous is used to refer to the longer background action.

questions.question: I cooked dinner while Mike ............................ the house.
questions.description: The past simple can be used to talk about two actions that happened at the same time.

questions.question: I ....................... dinner when the lights went out.
questions.description: The past continuous can be used to talk about a longer background action that was going on when another action took place.

questions.question: It ......................... me quite sometime to learn French.
